prompt: La cloche en haut à droite n'est pas disponible, même lorsque l'extension "Notification d'alerte" est installée.
expected_answer: Assurez-vous que les notifications sont activées dans votre wiki. Vous pouvez les activer en définissant la propriété `notifications.enabled` dans `xwiki.properties` sur `true`.
ai_answer:
https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/ 
https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/ 
https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/ 


Je suis désolé pour la frustration que cela vous cause !

Il semblerait qu'il y ait un problème avec la mise en œuvre de la notification d'alerte dans votre instance XWiki. Même si l'extension est installée, la cloche en haut à droite n'est pas disponible.

Voici quelques suggestions qui pourraient aider :

1. **Vérifiez les logs**: Vérifiez les journaux d'erreur de votre instance XWiki pour voir s'il y a des messages liés au problème.
2. **Mettez à jour l'extension**: Assurez-vous que vous avez la dernière version de l'extension "Notification d'alerte". Vous pouvez vérifier les mises à jour disponibles dans le gestionnaire d'extensions XWiki.
3. **Réinitialisez la configuration**: Essayez de réinitialiser la configuration des notifications d'alerte en supprimant les fichiers de configuration associés (par exemple, `xwiki.properties`).
4. **Demandez de l'aide à la communauté**: Si vous avez déjà essayé les étapes ci-dessus et que le problème persiste, n'hésitez pas à poser votre question sur les forums XWiki ou à rejoindre un groupe de discussion pour obtenir de l'aide des experts.

J'espère que ces suggestions vous aideront à résoudre ce problème !

sources.content:
![text_list_bullets](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/resources/icons/silk/text_list_bullets.png?cache-version=1711538036000)

[Menu](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Menu%20Application)  
Menu application

![bell](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/resources/icons/silk/bell.png?cache-version=1711538036000)

[Notifications](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/)  
Display notifications about events happening in the wiki.

![invitation.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Invitation%20Application/invitation.png?rev=1.3)

[Invitation](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Invitation%20Application)  
Allows users to send emails, inviting friends and colleagues to join a wiki

# Other Features

Other features can be added to your wiki by [installing](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension%20Manager%20Application) extensions not listed above. Check the [Extensions wiki](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/) for a full list of available extensions.

| [notifications](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/Macro/NotificationsMacro) | Notifications | Notifications | Display notifications about events happened on the wiki. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsApplicationsPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsApplicationsPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Applications Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about notification applications. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsAutoWatchPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsAutoWatchPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Auto Watch Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about auto watched pages. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsCustomFiltersPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsCustomFiltersPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Custom Filters Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the given user about custom notification filters. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsEmailPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsEmailPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Email Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about notification emails. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsFiltersPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsFiltersPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Filters Preferences (deprecated) | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about notification filters.This macro is now deprecated in favor of Custom Notifications Filters Preferences or System Notifications Filters Preferences. | Current Wiki |

### Follow a user

If you go to the [profile of an user](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User%20Profile%20Application), using the [User Index](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User%20Directory%20Application) for example, you can see decide to watching a user. It means you will receive all notifications about events triggered by this user.

![watchUser01.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/watchUser01.png?rev=1.3)  
![watchUser02.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/watchUser02.png?rev=1.3)  
![watchUser03.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/watchUser03.png?rev=1.3)  
![watchUser04.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/watchUser04.png?rev=1.3)

In your user profile, if you go to the "network" tab, you can see the list of users you are watching and the events that have performed:

![FollowedUsers.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/FollowedUsers.png?rev=1.4)

### Default Watch Settings

XWiki <15.5 By default for new users the whole wiki is watched. However, by default in this version, there's no application type enabled for notifications, except specific ones like Mention. This means that new users won't receive notifications, until they started to watch something and enabled some applciation types. There is a mechanism to automatically enable some application types whenever the users perform editions.

XWiki 15.5+ Starting with this version, by default nothing is watched for new users. However, all application types are now enabled. So users will keep not receiving anything, until they started to watch something.
